Climate, Vegetation, and Land Use

Koeppen Climate Class

Af:Tropical rain forest Am:Tropical monsoon Aw:Tropical savanna Bsh:Steppe: very cold winter Bsk:Steppe: warm winter Bwh:Desert: warm winter Bwk:Desert: very cold winter Cfa:Humid Subtropical: mild with no dry season, hot summer Cfb:Marine West Coast: mild with no dry season, warm summer Cfc:Marine West Coast: mild with no dry season, cool summer Csa:Mediterranean: mild with dry, hot summer Csb:Mediterranean: mild with dry, warm summer Cwa:Humid Subtropical: dry winter, hot summer Cwb:Temperate Highland: dry winter, warm summer Cwc:Temperate Highland: dry winter, cool summer Dfa:Humid Continental: humid with severe winter, no dry season, hot summer Dfb:Warm Summer Continental: significant precipitation in all seasons Dfc:Subarctic: severe winter, no dry season, cool summer Dfd:Subarctic: severe, very cold winter, no dry season, cool summer Dsa:Dry Continental: hot summer Dsb:Warm Summer Continental: warm summer Dsc:Dry Continental: cool summer Dsd:Subarctic: severe, very cold winter, dry cool summer Dwa:Humid Continental: humid with severe winter, no dry season, warm summer Dwb:Warm Summer Continental: dry winters Dwc:Subarctic: severe, dry winter, cool summer Dwd:Subarctic: severe, very cold and dry winter, cool summer EF:Ice Cap ET:Tundra

Vegetation (IGBP)

BSV:Barren Sparse Vegetation CRO:Croplands CSH:Closed Shrublands CVM:Cropland/Natural Vegetation Mosaics DBF:Deciduous Broadleaf Forests DNF:Deciduous Needleleaf Forests EBF:Evergreen Broadleaf Forests ENF:Evergreen Needleleaf Forests GRA:Grasslands MF:Mixed Forests OSH:Open Shrublands SAV:Savannas SNO:Snow and Ice URB:Urban and Built-Up Lands WAT:Water Bodies WET:Permanent Wetlands WSA:Woody Savannas
